DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether 18F-FDG PET/CT-based prognostic model of diffuse large B-cell lymphoma can predict disease progression
DOC.brief_title: 18F-FDG PET/CT-based Prognostic Model for Predicting Outcome in Patients With Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma
DOC.detailed_description: In this study investigators develop a prognostic model based on 18F-FDG PET/CT and test its ability for prognostic value in patients with DLBCL. PET/CT scans evaluation using the liver SUVmax as reference. Positive lesions in PET were indicated as SUVmax of residues higher than the threshold (1.6 fold of liver SUVmax) or new 18F-FDG avid lesions. 18F-FDG PET/CT-based prognostic model includes PET/CT image, dominant clinical and pathological prognostic factors to predicting disease progression during chemotherapy or survival in DLBCL.
DOC.criteria: 1. newly diagnosed DLBCL; 2. treated using an anthracyclinecontaining regimen with or without rituximab; 3. minimal followup at 6 months after the completion of firstline treatment; 4. complete medical history and clinicopathological data 1. secondary malignant disease; 2. serious infection or inflammation (e.g., HIV); 3. primary central nervous system lymphoma; 4. hepatic or renal dysfunction.
